docs.abstract: This week’s Poetry Pairing matches “One Girl of Many,” a poem by Charlotte Anna Perkins Gilman, with “Taking the High Road” by Abby Goodnough.
docs.snippet: This week’s Poetry Pairing matches “One Girl of Many,” a poem by Charlotte Anna Perkins Gilman, with “Taking the High Road” by Abby Goodnough.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Time Warner to Spin Off Time Inc., and Facebook's New Look

docs.abstract: Time Warner will spin off its magazine titles, Facebook will revamp its News Feed and Google executives try to bring advertisers into social media.
docs.snippet: Time Warner will spin off its magazine titles, Facebook will revamp its News Feed and Google executives try to bring advertisers into social media.

docs.lead_paragraph: The city’s public education effort speaks frankly about the increased chances that teenage mothers will become impoverished, but critics say it reinforces stereotypes.

headline.seo: City Campaign Targeting Teenage Pregnancy Draws Criticism
headline.main: Posters on Teenage Pregnancy Draw Fire
headline.print_headline: Posters on Teenage Pregnancy Draw Fire

docs.abstract: New York City public education campaign targeting teenage pregnancy speaks frankly about the increased chances that teenage mothers will become impoverished, but critics say it reinforces negative stereotypes about teenage mothers without offering any information to help girls prevent unplanned pregnancies.
docs.snippet: The city’s public education effort speaks frankly about the increased chances that teenage mothers will become impoverished, but critics say it reinforces stereotypes.

docs.lead_paragraph: A law enacted Wednesday contradicts the 24-week limit established by the Supreme Court, and abortion rights groups have promised a suit to block the ban before it goes into effect.

headline.main: Arkansas Adopts a Ban on Abortions After 12 Weeks
headline.print_headline: Arkansas Adopts A 12-Week Limit For Abortions

docs.abstract: Arkansas adopts a ban on abortion at 12 weeks of pregnancy, the most restrictive in the country; abortion rights groups promise a lawsuit to block the ban, which contradicts the limit established by the Supreme Court.
docs.snippet: A law enacted Wednesday contradicts the 24-week limit established by the Supreme Court, and abortion rights groups have promised a suit to block the ban before it goes into effect.

docs.lead_paragraph: Julio Acevedo, who was wanted in a hit-and-run accident in Brooklyn that killed a young couple and their child, surrendered to New York police detectives in Pennsylvania.

headline.seo: Julio Acevedo, Man Wanted in Fatal Hit and Run Crash, Turns Himself In
headline.main: Suspect in Crash That Killed 3 Turns Himself In
headline.print_headline: Suspect in Crash That Killed Brooklyn Couple and Child Turns Himself In

docs.abstract: Julio Acevedo, who was wanted in a hit-and-run accident in Brooklyn that killed a young couple and their child, surrenders to authorities in Pennsylvania.
docs.snippet: Julio Acevedo, who was wanted in a hit-and-run accident in Brooklyn that killed a young couple and their child, surrendered to New York police detectives in Pennsylvania.

headline.main: City Life Takes a Toll on China's Children

docs.abstract: Widespread anecdotal evidence suggests that children are suffering as parents live the hard life in China’s cities.
docs.snippet: Widespread anecdotal evidence suggests that children are suffering as parents live the hard life in China’s cities.

docs.lead_paragraph: A reader responds to Anna Jesus’ Sunday Review article about being pregnant in medical school.
docs.snippet: A reader responds to Anna Jesus’ Sunday Review article about being pregnant in medical school.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State Senate voted 20 to 14 Tuesday to override Gov. Mike Beebe’s veto of a bill that would establish the country’s most stringent limits on abortion, banning the procedure after 12 weeks of pregnancy.
docs.abstract: Arkansas State Senate votes 20 to 14 to override Gov Mike Beebe's veto of a bill that would establish the country's most stringent limits on abortion, banning the procedure after 12 weeks of pregnancy.
docs.snippet: The State Senate voted 20 to 14 Tuesday to override Gov. Mike Beebe’s veto of a bill that would establish the country’s most stringent limits on abortion, banning the procedure after 12 weeks of pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: If confirmed, this would be the first time a person has been cured with simple drug treatments, making a lifetime of antiviral therapy unnecessary.

headline.seo: The Intriguing Case of a Baby Cured of H.I.V.
headline.main: The Intriguing Case of a Baby Cured of H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: The Intriguing Case of a Baby Cured of H.I.V.

docs.abstract: Editorial holds that news of doctors apparently curing baby infected with HIV should be viewed cautiously; contends if case proves to be replicable, strong early treatment of HIV infection could become standard of care around world; warns that even if treatment works, prevention is best defense against mother-to-child transmission of HIV.
docs.snippet: If confirmed, this would be the first time a person has been cured with simple drug treatments, making a lifetime of antiviral therapy unnecessary.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Mike Beebe vetoed legislation on Monday that would have banned abortions 12 weeks into a pregnancy if a fetal heartbeat was detected using an abdominal ultrasound.

headline.seo: Arkansas: Governor Vetoes New Abortion Restriction
headline.main: Arkansas: Governor Vetoes New Abortion Restriction
headline.print_headline: Arkansas: Governor Vetoes New Abortion Restriction

docs.abstract: Arkansas Gov Mike Beebe vetoes legislation that would have banned abortions 12 weeks into pregnancy if fetal heartbeat was detected using abdominal ultrasound.
docs.snippet: Gov. Mike Beebe vetoed legislation on Monday that would have banned abortions 12 weeks into a pregnancy if a fetal heartbeat was detected using an abdominal ultrasound.
